Author: Alright#0419
Content: @josephnicholas GMT+8 we run a fungible cluster of assetchains in #kmdlabs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Our chains' base coin is fungible across many chains

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's not a token on top of any coin

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ah reread what you said. Seems you're asking about the assets contract. With assets contract you can create tokens. If you want a non-fungible token, you simply create a single token

Author: Alright#0419
Content: these tokens can be traded for the chain's base coin via the on-chain DEX, but you cannot transfer them between chains at the moment

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: How do I participate in #kmdlabs ?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: #kmdlabs is based around a coin, LABS, which has not launched yet. It intends to be an incentivized testnet for dapps and cryptoconditions. You can participate now by testing features we are getting ready or by getting people to test your dapp or cryptocondition

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we have a handful of dapps in development that you could test right now along with all the komodo CCs available to test

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if you wait ~2 months, you could try to get a spot as a LABS notary

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904

Author: Alright#0419
Content: At the moment, you just need to find something you want to work on, and we can help you along the way. I can give you some examples of dapps we're developing. @blackjok3r made an assetchain parameter, ac_streamer, which allows for decentralized immutable streaming.  @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator is working on supply chain-esque project. He's tracking his dog via GPS and pushing data to an oracle. I've built something I'm calling "trollbox" which is on-chain real time chat

Author: Alright#0419
Content: once we launch, all these dapps will be available for incentivized testing

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @josephnicholas GMT+8 is there anything you're interested in particular? Maybe we can brainstorm some ideas for what you could work on?

Content: building and breaking is the best way to learn

Author: walrus#8604
Content:
just a quick question:
I have set up an asset chain...on a remote aws node
say, that node is node 1
other nodes are joining in.....to that asset chain
previously node 1 was able to transfer coins to other nodes...but now whenever node 1 sends coins to other nodes....on other nodes logs it shows: ERROR: AcceptToMemoryPool: tx inputs not found
Transactions from other nodes are going through fine
But coin transfers from node 1 is not being accepted.
any idea what could be the reason?
From node-1's wallet, coins are being deducted...but on recipient's end it says: ERROR: AcceptToMemoryPool: tx inputs not found

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @walrus Hmm I had similar errors (`AcceptToMemoryPool`) when spin nodes in cloud - in my case problem was in security group settings. Try to allow inbound-outbound on all ports to see if it works

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Ephemeral ports using for mempools syncing as I understand and by default AWS VPC security settings blocked such connections. As soon as I adjusted network security rules I was able not only sync nodes blocks but sync mempools as well.

Author: walrus#8604
Content: @TonyL  Thanks so much! I adjusted the network settings..now its working fine. üòÉ

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@Mihailo 

When you get a chance, can you please review this CC-Gateways documentation?

I have taken it as far as my knowledge of CC-Gateways allows. 

There are many elements in the docs where the nature of how it works becomes foggy to me, so I've done the best I can to describe what I know, and now I leave it up to the dev team to point out technical errors.

If you can find time to help on this, the best way to do it is to fork the dev branch to your own local github repo, make whatever changes you want there, and then send everything back as a single pull request. 

Thank you, let me know if you'll have time.

https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/developer-docs/blob/master/docs/basic-docs/cryptoconditions/cc-gateways.md

Content: Don't worry about grammar.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I have been trying to make web app for ROGUE since last week or so.
so, the first task was to figure out how to show this Terminal only game over a web page, for which I'm using GoTTY go code, in combination of Go's native net/http and template library to just make the basic web page for initial tests.
I was trying to modify the behaviour of GoTTY, but for some reason it's not accepting my customisation in it's compiled js, and it's packaged .gohtml file. Spent good amount of time scratching my head around it why. So, not to spend enough time on just that 3rd paty package, I'm gonna use alternative solution which I had in mind. I'll try to use Go concurency, go routines + channels + websockets to manage the behavior I want.
Which is, user input taken from a web page -> Web TTY is displayed to user with game ready to play -> Game ends -> Web TTY session ends -> { At this point the user should be redirected back to the web interface with controls to do further actions }. This last part was where I spent long time troubleshooting. Will test websockets with my test practice code tomorrow.
If anyone wants to peak at my test code for Go language, I push that here:
https://github.com/satindergrewal/golang-practice

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Hopefully I'll still be able to make ROGUE work via Web App by 28th. Still targeting the same date.

Content: @grewalsatinder maybe look at an example open source web app in go to see how they do stuff? I can honestly say I've never read the code to a Go web app, but I am sure they exist

Content:

Content: Catex Exchange uses CentOS.  Has anyone been able to build Komodo on CentOS 7 and/or have instructions for the build?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @grewalsatinder i don't know shit about Go, but that happens to me in other languages. Sounds like your tests are using the system version of the package, not yours, which might mean changing some environment variable or something to change where it looks for code first. Or like in python, sometimes you can have an old compiled version of a .py (which is .pyc) which masks the changes in the source code, until you delete the cached binary

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
it does look like the dependencies all built clean on CentOS: https://ci.z.cash/#/builders/13/builds/760/steps/4/logs/stdio

the only issue i can see is the linker can not find a set of libs when building gtests: 

```
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lpthread
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lstdc++
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lm
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lpthread
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lc
```

you can try disabling the gtest build and see if it passes - let me know how it goes.
